Authors: Hanxing Gao, Yukun Ma, Zhaoxiang Zhu
Title:
First description of the sexual stage of Querciphoma Crous
and a new species from China
Keywords: Han-Xing Gao, Yu-Kun Ma, Zhao-Xiang Zhu
Abstract:
Using combined analyses of morphological data, culture
characters and molecular phylogeny, a new species of the monotypic genus
Querciphoma (Ascomycota, Dothideomycetes) discovered in Henan, China is
described and illustrated. The fungus is distinguished by larger smooth,
hyaline, cylindrical conidia with one or three middle contracted
septate. Phylogenetic position of Querciphoma sophoracola is explored
based on a multilocus sequence analysis of the ITS, LSU, small subunit
18S nrDNA (SSU), and translation elongation factor 1-alpha (tef1)
regions. The sexual stage of Querciphoma which is charactered of smaller
ascomata, multi-transversely septate and biseriate ascospore is reported
firstly.
